page.description: Formats an input string using a format_code. Returns a character string.

prototypes.prototype: Result_String as C = format_data(* input_value ,C format_code [,N fld_width [,N fld_dec ]])
Result_String as C = FORMAT_DATA( Input_Value as D, Format_Code as C )
Result_String as C = FORMAT_DATA( Input_Value as L, Format_Code as C )
Result_String as C = FORMAT_DATA( Input_Value as N, Format_Code as C [, Field_Width as N [, Field_Decimal as N ]] )

argument.name: input_value
argument.description: A character, numeric, date, or logical value.

argument.name: format_code
argument.description: A format string. Refer to Display Formats. Character

argument.name: fld_width
argument.description: Optional. Maximum number of characters to return. Numeric

argument.name: fld_dec
argument.description: Optional. If the input is numeric, the maximum number of characters after the decimal point. Numeric

page.discussion: The FORMAT_DATA() function formats a character, date, numeric, or logical value.
